title: Configure Service Portal display theme settings
content:
Service Management provides multiple out-of-the-box display themes for the Service Portal and Standard is the default display theme. You can create a custom display theme to suit your company's look and feel.

This feature isn't available if you use a screen with width less than 1024 pixels (such as tablet, tablet PC, or mobile phone) to access Service Portal.

For a quick guide describing the basic settings for the portal, see Quick guide to customizing the Service Portal.

Theme Settings page user interface

On Service Portal main page, click and select Theme Settings.

Interface item Description
Theme

The theme for the Service Portal that is displayed.

Click “ ▼ ” to display a drop-down list of themes. You may select a previously created theme.

Click “ + ” to create a theme.

The following themes come out of the box:

  • Standard (default)
  • ITSM
  • CMP
  • AMX

By default, the Standard (default) theme settings are displayed.

The AMX theme is available only for new tenants. For tenants created before 2021.11, you can manually create a theme.
Preview

When you select Theme Settings, the following message is displayed on the top of the screen.

The setting is only previewed and not saved until you click Save or Save & Exit.
More

When you have selected a theme other than the default, click "   " to display the following options:

  • Rename - select to rename the theme.
  • Delete - select to delete the theme.
  • Enable - select to enable the theme. Only available for selection when the theme is disabled.
  • Disable - select to disable the theme. Only available for selection when the theme is enabled.
  • Set as default - select to set the theme as the default. Only available for selection when the theme is enabled.
Settings tab Area where you define the settings for the theme.
Audience tab Area where you apply entitlement rules to select the audience for a theme.

For more information about how each field in the editor affects the Service Portal display, see the Service Portal display theme settings section below.

The default, out-of-the-box display theme for the Service Portal is defined and saved in the system.

To revert to using the default display theme for the Service Portal, click “ ▼ ” and select Standard.

Add a new theme

  1. Click  “ + ” to create a theme.
    The Create New Theme dialog box is displayed.
  2. Type a suitable name for the theme.
  3. From the drop-down list, select the theme to provide the initial settings that you want to customize.
    For example, assume you previously created a custom theme named Alpha. You now want to create a similar theme, based on Alpha, but perhaps with changes to the text color, and background. First, you would give your new theme a name. Then, you would select Alpha from the drop-down list. If you want to create a theme based on the Standard theme, you would select Standard from the drop-down list.
  4. Click Create. The theme is displayed, but disabled.
  5. To enable the theme, click "   ", and select Enable.
  6. Edit the settings as required.
  7. Click Save.
  8. To make the theme the default, click "   ", and select Set as default.

Set the audience for a custom theme

You can set the audience for a custom theme, so only that audience may see the theme, by using an entitlement rule.

You can't use an entitlement rule with:

  • The out-of-the-box Standard theme

  • The currently selected default theme

    If you want to use an entitlement rule with a custom theme that's the currently selected default theme, you must first select another theme as the default theme.

  1. Ensure you have a suitable entitlement rule. For more information, see How to manage entitlement rules.
  2. From main page, click and select Theme Settings.
  3. If the custom theme you want isn't already selected, click and select the theme.
  4. Click the Audience tab in the left pane.
  5. Click Add and select the entitlement rule from the drop-down.
  6. Click Save.

You must enable a theme before it displays to users.

Service Portal display theme settings

  • All color codes must be provided in hexadecimal format.
  • Click Save to save your custom theme.

The following table describes the theme settings:

Section Fields Affected area of Service Portal display
Header

Name

Font/Text size/Text color/Bold

Logo

Background

Logo Background

Agent interface header label

Agent interface header logo

Agent interface header background

Agent interface logo background
Agent interface menu logo

Display product version

Note: 

The recommended image size for the Service Portal logo is 64 x 64 pixels. 

The recommended image size for the Agent interface logo is 32 x 32 pixels. 

The Agent interface header label, logo, background, and logo background are available in Service Management rather than in Service Portal.

The color of the main menu icon is also controlled by the Header Text color.

The "Agent interface menu logo" setting only takes effect in the hamburger menu of JATO UI.
The "Agent interface header background" and "Agent interface logo background" settings also take effect on the logo and header in the hamburger menu of JATO UI.
See the following image for the settings applied to the JATO UI hamburger menu components:
Action ribbon

Search box background

Ribbon button foreground

Ribbon button background

Ribbon button hover

Ribbon text

Ribbon text hover
Global page setting

Size of category tiles in landing page

Large: 3 tiles per line

Medium: 4 tiles per line

Small: 6 tiles per line

Background image

Page background

Page title

Page header background opacity

Section title

Content text

Link


Note:

The default background image is with width of 1500 pixels and height of 840 pixels.

You can enter 0-1 to the page header background opacity. The default value is 0.7.
Link mouseover
Clickable text

Dropdown list background
Buttons

Submit button text

Submit button background

Action button text

Action button 1 background

Action button 2 background

Buttons disabled color
Callout

My callout background

My callout text

Counterpart callout background

Counterpart callout text
Miscellaneous

Search keyword highlight

Record form background

Notification bar text color

Notification bar background color

Sidebar text

Sidebar background

Sidebar background blur

Note: The blur setting blurs the image selected for the background of the sidebar. You can enter a two digit number. 0 displays the image as it is and 99 blurs the image till it is nearly opaque. 9 is the default setting.

Notification text

Notification background

Text color on category tile
Category text background color

Category text background blur

Category font size

Category in bold font

Tips: If you have already embedded the text in your category image, you can set the text color to transparent.

Note:
The default value of Category text background color is RGBA: 0,0,0,0.4. Where the last value, 0.4, is the category text background opacity. You can set 0-1 as the category text background opacity.
You can adjust the strength of the background blur effect by changing the value (in unit of px). The higher the value, the greater the blur.
Filter background color
To Do & Header drop down menu

Foreground color

Text
Request Grid

Font size of the header in Request grid

Font size of the row in Request grid

Set background color for even rows
Custom widget 

In addition to the standard options above, you can also use a custom widget to embed your own Web Components or static HTML contents to certain theme areas. See Service Portal custom widgets.

Catalog icons

Please note that this setting is still located in the Agent Interface: Service Portal Settings > Theme Settings.

Click the link to access the Service Catalog Management page where you can design the category tiles. You can mix and match between selecting background images and background colors.

For details, see How to design category tiles for the Service Portal.


The category tile is displayed as a 32-bit PNG image with 294 x 250 pixels.
The distance of the category text box to the bottom of a category tile is about one third of the height of a category tile.

Sample images pack

Click the link - Click here to download sample images pack - from the UI (Agent Interface > Service Portal Settings > Theme Settings) to download a zip file containing sample images you can use as portal background images, category icons, and offering icons.
